column2: TENNESSEE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. Speed limit signs are:
2. This road sign means:
3. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column6: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column8: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.

column2: 4. A driver license may be suspended or revoked for:
column6: allowing another individual to use your license or identification.

column2: 5. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column6: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column8: find a safe place to stop for a break.

column2: 6. Diamond-shaped signs:
column8: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 7. When passing a motorcycle you must:
column4: give the motorcyclist the right hand part of his traffic lane.
column6: give the motorcyclist the entire traffic lane as if the motorcycle was a car.
column8: sound your horn to alert the motorcyclist.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
9. If the rear of your vehicle is skidding to the right, you should:
column8: hold the steering wheel tightly and shift into neutral to bring the front of the vehicle back in line.

column2: 10. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
11. When a pedestrian carrying a white cane is at the corner ready to cross the street in front of you, before making your right turn, you should:
column4: turn off the ignition until the person crosses the street.
column6: yield the right-of-way and wait until the pedestrian crosses the street.
column8: use your horn to help the pedestrian cross the street.

column2: 12. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
13. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column6: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
15. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column6: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column8: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.

column2: 16. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
17. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column8: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.

column2: 18. Roads are the most slippery:
column4: the first rain after a dry spell.
column6: after it has been raining for an hour or more.
column8: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.

column2: 19. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column6: cut abruptly in front of it.
column8: pay close attention to the turn signals.

column2: 20. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
21. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
column6: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
23. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
24. A red arrow on a traffic light means:
column4: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
column6: You may turn in in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.
column8: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.

column2: 25. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column6: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column8: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 26. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column6: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column8: be ready to stop at the stop sign.

column2: 27. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
28. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
29. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Not drinking over a period of time.
column6: Eating before or while you drink.

column2: 30. When driving on the freeway behind large trucks, you should:
column4: move to the right of the truck and pass it quickly.
column6: drive closer behind the truck than for a passenger vehicle.
